Pre-Game Insights: Portland Trail Blazers are on a seven-game road slide and will attempt to break it against the Los Angeles Lakers.
The Lakers are 15-7 against Western Conference opponents and are fourth in the Western Conference with 50.1 points per game in the paint, led by Anthony Davis averaging 14.8.
The Trail Blazers have gone 10-19 against Western Conference opponents and give up 117.3 points to opponents while being outscored by 9.2 points per game.
Anthony Davis is averaging 26.1 points, 11.6 rebounds, 3.5 assists, and two blocks for the Lakers.
Anfernee Simons is averaging 17.5 points and 4.9 assists for the Trail Blazers.
In their last 10 games, the Lakers are 6-4, averaging 112.9 points, 43.3 rebounds, 26.0 assists, 8.5 steals, and 5.9 blocks per game while shooting 47.2% from the field.
In their last 10 games, the Trail Blazers are 3-7, averaging 110.1 points, 43.0 rebounds, 24.4 assists, 7.0 steals, and 4.9 blocks per game while shooting 45.6% from the field.
Lakers' injuries include Jarred Vanderbilt (out, knee), Gabe Vincent (day to day, oblique), Christian Wood (out, knee), and Jalen Hood-Schifino (day to day, hamstring).
Trail Blazers' injuries include Matisse Thybulle (out, ankle), Dalano Banton (day to day, hip), and Jerami Grant (day to day, face).
